alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale; Geneva; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 8:53AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Dale, southern Coffee, northern Geneva and northwestern Houston Counties through 930 AM CDT... At 853 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Geneva to 13 miles northwest of Laurel Hill. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Daleville, Elba, Dothan, Enterprise, Fort Rucker, Ozark, Hartford, Taylor, Midland City, Level Plains, Slocomb, Samson, Newton, New Brockton, Pinckard, Malvern, Clayhatchee, Grimes, Kinston and Napier Field. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
